result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A Sandoval

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher A Sandoval appeared by video.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin appeared by video for Christopher A Sandoval.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf of Patrick T. Franken  for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the State. Defense further requests an additional status conference date, for more time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher A Sandoval appeared by video.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin appeared by video for Christopher A Sandoval.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 086027,
Payable Number: 1031109,
Receipt Number: 22RP036218,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Christopher A Sandoval in court. Attorney Ashley Fard appeared in court.  Student Intern Abigail Doweiko under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Tom Potter who is available by phone.Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/2/22 @ 2:30p
